Events.CanCreate:
(switch (not (@ gData 'targetID)) Nil
; If the target is still alive, then we can create the mission
(objGetObjByID (@ gData 'targetID)) )
Events.OnCreate:
(block ( (targetObj (objGetObjByID (@ gData 'targetID))) (targetLevel (objGetProperty targetObj 'level)) ) (msnSetData gSource 'targetID (@ gData 'targetID)) (msnRegisterForEvents gSource targetObj)
; Compute reward
(msnSetData gSource 'reward (switch (leq targetLevel 10) (@ '(0 500 1000 2000 4000 8000 15000 30000 65000 130000 250000) targetLevel)
500000 ) ) )
Events.OnObjDestroyed:
(switch (!= (objGetID aObjDestroyed) (msnGetData gSource 'targetID)) Nil
(not aDestroy) (msnFailure gSource { status:'targetLeft })
(and aOrderGiver (= aOrderGiver gPlayerShip)) (msnSuccess gSource { status:'killedByPlayer })
(msnSuccess gSource { status:'killedByOther }) )
Events.OnReward:
; Called when the mission was successful, just before showing ; the debriefing screen. ; ; gSource: Mission object. ; gData: Arbitrary data passed to msnReward ; ; This event can return an optional structure to control ; debriefing. The struct has the following fields: ; ; nextScreen: The screen to show after debrief, OR ; 'forceUndock ; nextScreenData: Data to pass to scrShowScreen.
(rpgMissionRewardPayment (msnGetData gSource 'reward))

Language.Text:
Your mission is to destroy %targetName% to avenge the destruction of %stationName%.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: %reward%
Rows of medbeds fill the makeshift triage center. An old woman holding a sofa pillow sits on a gurney nearby. Her eyes are red and puffy, but her jaw is clenched in anger.

She stares at you for a second and then blinks.
"%TargetName% hit us. It came right out of the black with no warning. All I remember is the pounding of the bulkheads and the screams."

The old woman stares, almost as if she recognizes you.
"You can kill the bastards for me. I'll give you %reward% if you hunt down and destroy the ship that did this to us. They can rot in the black forever and maybe then I'll feel better."

The old woman nods.
"Yeah, maybe I'll feel better."
Language.String:
The old woman slumps forward with a sigh.
"I don't know what I'm saying. I'm glad Aaron can't see me like this."
She starts to sob quietly, and you decide to leave.
Language.Text:
As you enter, the old woman grabs your shoulder:
"You promised me! Get out there and make things right!"

The old woman is there waiting for you, but she doesn't look any happier than before.
"You did what you said, and maybe now I can rest. I've deposited %reward% as promised."
You find the old woman lying on a medbed. She gives you a look of disappointment and then turns away without a word.
